headline: Libby's Famous Pumpkin Pie
description: Libby's pumpkin pie with evaporated milk is a classic, no-fail holiday dessert that's so easy to make! It's been enjoyed by families for years.
name: Libby's Famous Pumpkin Pie
recipeIngredient: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can NESTLE® CARNATION® Evaporated Milk

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Combine sugar, cinnamon, salt, ginger, and cloves in small bowl. Beat eggs lightly in large bowl. Stir in pumpkin and sugar-spice mixture. Gradually stir in evaporated milk. Pour into pie shell.

Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and continue to bake until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean, 40 to 50 more minutes. Remove from the oven and set on a wire rack to cool to room temperature.
Serve cooled pie immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. (Do not freeze as this will cause the crust to separate from the filling.)

review.reviewBody: It's Very Good, But could be richer tasting using buttermilk! I didn't have any so i did have evaporated milk and a can of pumpkin. My nephew was asking for pie, he's only 7, I figured we'd do what we could with what we have. Excellent recipe for this! Tastes good, a little heavy, but cuts great, looks great, easy enough a 7 Year Old can make it.

You can't beat the filling. To me, it's the best pumpkin pie when it comes to taste. For some reason, my crust doesn't cook well though. I usually use the store-bought kind. I am on the lookout for a better pie crust that can handle this recipe.

I've made this recipe for nearly 60 years and I don't change anything, except I do use fresh pumpkin at Thanksgiving and Christmas, because somethings are so good they just need to be left alone. Libby's pumpkin pie is one of those things.
I've made this 3 or 4 times now and it's been wonderful each time.

The first time I made this I follow the directions exactly and enjoyed a favorable pumpkin pie made with a store-bought frozen pie shell. As there was extra filling, I used the second pie shell in a muffin tin. Had enough for 6 "tarts". The next time I made my own pie crust, and it was much better. Ok, I made a mistake on the recipe and used a can of Condensed Milk, so it added an equal amount of milk and baked until a fork came out clean. Took and additional 10 minutes baked on a lower rack. Loved the richer taste of the pumpkin filling.
LOVED IT! MY GRANDSON ATE BOTH THE PUMPKIN PIES I MADE. HE JUST LOVED AS WELL.
I use this recipe for Thanksgiving / Christmas / whenever someone requests a pumpkin pie. Someone is always wanting to take the pumpkin pies home.
My first time making and having pumpkin pie. It is a bit sweeter than I imagined. Tasts a lot like pumpkin fritters that we have often here in South Africa

I've made this recipe often over the years and it's always been good, but with a few modifications this year it was truly great. Based on other comments and tips, I used 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/4 cup granulated sugar, doubled all spices, added: 1/4 tsp allspice, an extra egg yolk, 1 T molasses, and 1 T flour. It was perfectly spiced, creamy, and most importantly it did not crack. I know tweaking recipes is frowned upon, but this is such a long standing recipe, I felt an update was appropriate. The original will always be a classic, but if you want to mix things up a bit, i encourage making a recipe your own. Happy baking!

This is the only pumpkin pie recipe worth using. Even if you can’t get Libbey’s pumpkin this is the only recipe needed. I use my own spice mixture, Ceylon Cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg clove and a pinch of cardamom.

This recipe is wonderful! So much better than store bought and easy to make. I did follow reviewers' advice and changed the sugar to 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/4 cup white sugar. Also, I added a little vanilla. More advice: put it on a cookie sheet before trying to put it in the oven. The next time I make it, I'll buy a deep dish pie crust. While the filling fit into the regular one, it was impossible to get it into the oven without spilling some over the edge. It still came out great and my family loved it!
I've tried other, fancier-looking recipes, but have come back around to this classic

Since I came to the United Sates from Puerto Rico, I have been doing this recipe for the past 40 years for every Thanksgiving dinner. This year 2022 Is not going to be different. I experimented with others just to come back to this one as per my family request. I was banned by my family to try another one, and I loved it. Happy Thanksgiving to all. God Bess.

This has always been my family's go to for the holidays, but a few small adjustments that honestly if my mom were still alive would probably kill me for sharing! But you guys gotta try this! So follow the Libby's recipe but only use half of the evaporated milk it calls for, the other half you'll replace with egg nog, add 1 1/2 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice, and only use half the ginger it calls for and that's it! Your family and friends will come back for seconds and thirds I PROMISE!! Yummy!! (sorry mom but I had to share!)

I use this recipe as a general guideline because I keep forgetting to write mine down. I swap the spices for 1 tbsp pumpkin pie spice and the milk for sweetened condensed and get rid of the sugar. I also make my own puree. This year I couldn't find sweetened so I used evaporated and the sugar. I made the recipe for 4 pies, filled each with 4 cups and I have a whole pies worth left over. It makes a good bit extra filling. Luckily I'm making 12 pies this year as take home gifts for family so the extra will save me some money on ingredients

I don't think I have ever made a homemade pumpkin pie. But I'm giving it a try this Thanksgiving. I saw this recipe and it just looked so easy and I have all of the ingredients except the canned pumpkin. I can make two pies for half of one good frozen pie at the store price. I just did the frozen pie mainly because it was easy. I used to make such huge Thanksgiving dinners but now it's just my husband and me. So our dinners are a lot smaller and things cost so much now it just makes sense to make it homemade. The reviews are good so why not... Happy Thanksgiving everyone!

I've been making this since I can remember and I'm almost 70, the only exception is I use 1/4 cup brown sugar and the rest granulated. I have a sweet tooth and it gives that kick of sweetness. Excellent Recipe!!

This is the ONLY pumpkin pie recipe that been used by our family for over 2 generations. I make my own crust, using cinnamon graham crackers and add a tablespoon of orange zest to the filling. Serve with fresh whipped cream. It's amazing
My grandmother used this recipe for years, as have I. The only thing we do different is use Pumpkin Pie spice in place of the spices, and EAGLE BRAND MILK in place of the Carnation evaporated milk.

Pre bake a Keebler GRAHAM CRACKER CRUST with 2 extra servings for about 3 to 4 minutes. Then add Libby's pumpkin pie filling. It is so much easier than messing with a regular pie crust and tastes even better! Also if you find that you have too much filling as some have reported, only use 3/4 of the can of carnation milk. I've learned to fill the pie crust about 3/4 full, then add the rest AFTER I have the pie in the oven. Just carefully slide the oven rack back into place once you have added the extra filling so it doesn't slop over the side.

A pro tip on this recipe is to double it and make 3 pies. It has a good amount of excess filling even in a deep dish crust. Otherwise, you can fill some ramekins with the remainder. I’ve been making this for 10+ years, and its always delicious.
Excellent pie. Classic really. Spicy but not overly so. So easy to put together. I bought a store brand frozen pie crust. It lacked on a lot of levels. Will not do that again.
This is a solid pumpkin pie! It's easy, it's going to turn out, and it's loved. I do double the spices because we like it a bit more flavorful on the spice part.
I just made this and there is too much filling for the pie crust (deep dish). Anybody else have this happen or suggestions?

This recipe makes the perfect pumpkin pie. I made the recipe exactly as written and wouldn’t make any adjustments. It is easy to put together and has wonderful texture and flavor. The family loved it.
The best everytime!
the recipe was easy to follow, but even in saying that I changed the ginger and cloves to nutmeg and all spice . they look delicious!
Very good!
I have put a low carb, low sugar twist on this favorite, by replacing the sugar with monk fruit sweetner and baking in glass dish (no crust required)
Added 1/4 more cloves an cinnamon liked it better in my opinion
It was easy and wonderfully simple in taste. Love it
It was easy to make, looked beautiful , and was so so good! Thank you for the recipe!

Easy simple but get compliments about how good it is.
Reminds me of my grandmother she used the same recipe .

I have made this for the last couple years for the holidays. It hasn't failed me yet. I tried some other recipes and they just weren't as delicious. Some time you just have to stick to the traditional recipes.

only used cinnamon 
subed the others for vanilla extract
used 12 oz of coconut milk
subbed the pumpkin for bananna

baking in six ramekins 
The recipe is a good guide to make custard desserts

Add another faithful baker of Libby’s pumpkin pie! I double all the spices and add a tablespoon of molasses per pie, as my great-grandmother, grandmother, and mother did. And my daughter uses this recipe as well. Why mess with success?
The best pumpkin pie recipe ever. Been using this recipe off their label for almost 50 years and it has never failed to impress!

This was my first time making pumpkin pie. I figured it would be easy enough so I just followed the recipe. I don’t think I overbaked it since I followed the recipe and I even checked on it a few minutes early to make sure it wouldn’t overbake, but it came out with three giant cracks near the pie crust.
I liked this recipe. My Mom always used this recipe, but we use 1 Tblsp of allspice instead of cloves.

I learned to make pumpkin pies like this when I was 10. It has been 59 yrs an it is still the only one I use. I thought my daughter when she was 10 an it is her go to pie recipe. It is spot on with the spices. Everyone that has ever ate my pie rave about it. Thanks for a great recipe it is great tried an true everytime.
This is my first pumpkin pie ever. I added a little more spice to taste…otherwise, followed recipe exactly as written. It’s PERFECT.
I made my own pie crust.
Excellent recipe with a velvety texture! Added a bit of vanilla, otherwise followed exactly.
It was excellent and sure to be a family favorite
Easy and yummy! I followed the directions with the exception of tweaking the oven temp a bit because I live in altitude. Came out great!

I have been making this pie for 50 years. I tweaked the recipe, though, and I like it better. Cinnamon is the only spice I use, and I add 1 teaspoon of lemon extract for 2 pies. This is the best pumpkin pie I have ever eaten, and my family thinks so, too!
Easy to make and great tasting
I always use this recipe, but I followed instructions on blender this time it was quick and easy. I also used one deep dish one regular frozen crust. Turned out well, no left over filling.

I am in my 50s and have never, not at all ever, liked pumpkin pie. Everyone raves about my mother's pumpkin pie and she has always used the Libby's recipe plus a dash or so of allspice...and still a nope for me. I have wanted so much to like it over the years and would take a taste here and there hoping to like it but just did not. So, there was no reason for me to even learn to make it. 

I was recently gifted two sugar pie pumpkins and, besides making roasted pumpkin seeds, I didn't know what to do with them. I didn't want to waste them and since my husband loves pumpkin pie (we met later in life) I thought I'd give it a try. I remembered my mom using the Libby's recipe so I searched and ended up here (after researching how to cook the pumpkin to make the puree). 

I don't even know where to start about the goldmine of amazing tips so many reviewers were generous enough to share! The tips I chose incorporate on my first ever pumpkin pie made it so amazing that for the first time in my life I not only liked it but loved it! My husband was a tad disappointed he had to share :) 

Thank you so much to all who shared their tweaks, tips, family secrets! Thank you Allrecipes for sharing the Libby's recipe! 

The tips I gathered and used are as follows:
*Use 2 tsp of cinnamon (instead of 1)
*Add 1 tsp vanilla
*Add 1/4 tsp Allspice
*1/2 c. dark brown sugar & 1/4 c. regular sugar (for the 3/4 c sugar)
* When pie is done turn off oven and let cool in oven until cool enough to refriger
My family loves it exactly as the recipe is written. Best ever!
This is always my favorite go to recipe for pumpkin pie! Perfect amount of spice ratio. Everyone in my family raves about it.
This is a really good recipe. However, I doubled the spices, (cinnamon, ginger, cloves), which makes it taste so good. My family loves it.

I love this recipe and always use it anytime I want to make a pumpkin pie. I’m allergic to dairy so I always use a can of coconut milk in replace of the condensed milk , leave out the watery layer at the bottom, and it is amazing!!!
I prepared the recipe as described but used 1/2 a can of evaporated milk and kept the oven at 350F from start to finish.

My mom made this pie for years, I’ve used this same recipe for years. I get pumpkin pie cravings year round so I make this a lot. Pie always comes out perfect. I sometimes add nutmeg to give it another layer of flavor. I’ve even substituted sweet potatoes for pumpkin to see the results, it worked well too. Makes an awesome pie!
This is good and classic, but I double the amount of spices and add a bit more sugar to the custard, and I sprinkle sugar on top after the first 15 minutes to makes it a bit more flavorful.
Excellent recipe.

Best pumpkin pie but if you want to take it to a new level, double the spices! Cinnamon, Cloves and Ginger. It will take the pie to a whole new level. My mom taught me that and I always get raves on my pies... And so does my daughter!
Always love this recipe, but I never use the clove because it’s too much spice. Also used a bit less evaporated milk to get a thicker filling. Absolutely perfect to my taste.
This is the only pumpkin pie recipe I've ever used. Last year I added one teaspoon of vanilla with the evaporated milk. It added depth to the flavor without changing it too much

I’ve been making this ever since my dad trusted me with the oven!! I add extra sugar and spices (not salt) but not by any specific amount as long as the spice mix comes out a darker brown it turns out right for me. It does taste a little more like cloves but that is great to me!

My husband and I have had better pumpkin pies. This recipe is missing more sweetness and more spices. I wonder if adding 1 to 1 1/4 C of sugar and doubling the spices would make it better. The consistency is fantastic, but the first bite it's just blah. And this recipe made 2 pies, not 1...which may explain why it might need ingredients increased. So, be prepared for that.

I give it a 5 star because it comes closest to my pie. But no nutmeg! I've never seen a pumpkin pie recipe that didn't call for nutmeg! Some recipes leave out the clove which is a sin. 425 degrees for 15 minutes works great. I will try 1/2 cup of brown sugar next week.

Excellent recipe! I did the Bourbon modification on the can (adding 2 Tbsp) at the end, except used Lemon Hart Blackpool spiced rum. Best pumpkin pie I've ever had.

Making it a second time, adding 1/4 tsp nutmeg, and 1 tsp dark molasses (in addition to the spiced rum).

This recipe is fantastic. Absolutely delicious as-is! There's no need to do this, but just for personal preference I reduce cloves to 1/8 t., add 1/8 t. nutmeg, and add a splash of vanilla. I also wrap the crust in foil for the entire baking time because I like my crust soft and not dry.

Classic recipe, but I change it up a bit. I use 1/2 C white sugar and 1/4 C light brown...heaping measurements of the spices. I add 1/8 t of allspice and 1-2 T molasses to taste. Gives a deeper, richer flavor which I, and my family, really like. If you choose frozen crusts...Marie Callendars deep dish are an acceptable replacement if you don’t feel like making a homemade crust. It’s good. 
Happy baking!
This was delicious!

I put in a 1/2 tsp. of nutmeg and decrease the cloves to 
1/8 of a tsp. for my family's personal tastes.
Best pumpkin pie I've ever eaten. I don't care for cloves, so substituted nutmeg instead. WONDERFUL pie!
Fabulous!! I do not like pie crust so I used a graham cracker ready crust. Loved it and will definitely make again!
NON-DAIRY! I made this with a can of evaporated coconut milk and it turned out perfectly! Delicious!

First let me start out by saying I love pumpkin pie! I usually buy my pumpkin pie but this year I thought I would try to make one. OMG! After eating this one I will never buy a pumpkin pie! This was so delicious! The spices were what made this so delicious for me. I followed the recipe exactly and wouldn’t change a thing. Very easy recipe. I even made the pie crust. Chef John’s recipe on this site. So easy too!
You need to pre bake the crust or it will be raw on the bottom. Found out the hard way. Followed directions to the letter and the bottom crust was raw. Edges were perfect.

Delicious results but the deep dish pie crust didn’t hold all of the filling so I baked the remaining filling in a small dish by itself. Also had to bake it much longer than called for in order to get the center to set - about 1.5 hrs.

This is my tried and true go-to recipe. I do modify, to everyone's delight--just the right amount of sweetness. I use lots less sugar - scant 1/2 cup dark brown sugar, more spices than called for, and a tsp of vanilla extract. I also layer chocolate chips on top just before baking (they sink otherwise), but that of course is optional. Because the filling is often quite watery as others have noted, today for Thanksgiving, I first beat the egg/sugar mixture with an electric hand beater to thicken it up, then mixed in the pumpkin and everything else with a mixing spoon per usual. It turned out beautifully!
Absolute perfection, every single time. Been using this recipe my whole life. It's the best.
Great recipe! I replace about 1/3 of the evaporated milk with Bailey's Irish Cream for some added flavor. Enjoy!
I made this last Thanksgiving everyone devoured it. So making it again.

I have used this recipe for years. Was looking on here for a new recipe maybe but based on all these great reviews, I think I will stick with this one. I always add a pinch of nutmeg and extea cinnamon.
I've used this recipe for decades and my family loves it. I cut the sugar to a half cup. 3/4 just makes it too sweet.

This is an awesome pie! Couldn’t find my big pie pan so used a regular pan, wow did it puff up. This filling was better than my crust so will have to keep practicing. very easy to put together and leaves plenty of room for creativity if you are in the mood for experimentation. I’d make it as written most of the time though. Hard to improve on profection.
I’ve always used this recipe. The only change I make is using heaping spoons on each spice. Just the little extra makes it extra special.
Great recipe! I substituted coconut milk for condensed milk and it was delicious
Great pie. I add extra cinnamon and cover the crust while baking with tinfoil so it doesn’t burn. Turns out yummy!

Love it without changes, although when preparing for people who are conscious of fat and sugar, I use the low-fat or nonfat evaporated milk and reduce the suggest to just under 1/2 C. This works fine with a blend of brown and white sugar and with all cinnamon if you don't have the other spices. I like this custard so much, I make it sometimes without the crust!

Best Ever!!! Always a tried and true one, never disappoints I made two pies. Also used deep dish crusts but there's always every time extra filling!- but that's OK!! I put it in a little casserole dish & bake it with the pies. However I do need to take it out sooner than the pies though of course. It's still delicious- even without the crust. My husband loves the pie & just the filling bake! 
(Middle and lower oven racks so crust doesn't burn.)
love it, did tweek a bit... 1/3 less milk, about 25% more of all the spices. Perfect any way you bake it...make it yours...Mac
Delicious! Thanks as I had to buy generic pumpkin and needed the original recipe. Thanks.

Very well. Most importamtly,
my husband really enjoyed it.

Instead of the spices listed. I used 1 tsp of pumpkin pie spice and 1 tsp of cinnamon.. And brushed my pie crust with egg whites. I baked it at 425 for 15 min. Then 20 min at 375 . then 25 mins at 350. It turned out delicious.
There is nothing better than a Libby's pumpkin pie!

Since I don’t have a mind that memorizes recipes, it is nice to have what I consider to be the best pumpkin pie recipe easily accessible if I happen to buy a different brand of canned pumpkin than Libby’s. Thanks for submitting this!
Great flavor, but not as firm as I would of liked.
Got my dad's seal of approval. All I can ask for!
love the spices!
love the spices!

Perfect . Everyone loved it and ask if I could make more.
This is the recipe I'll use in the future.

This is the best pumpkin pie I have ever made. Used this recipe for the first time and everyone loved it. I substituted the pie crust for an xl graham cracker one as people in our family hate pie crust. It looked a little brown but everyone loved it!!

Perfect pumpkin pie!!
Have made this recipe year after year! It is always loved.
